timeline.bodyText:
Why is this 32? It should be 30... I think you are missing brackets in

  
    
      vespa/node-repository/src/main/java/com/yahoo/vespa/hosted/provision/autoscale/NodeMetricsDb.java
    
    
         Line 86
      in
      a54b2bb
    
    
    
    

        
          
           int measurementsInWindow = measurements.size() - largestIndexOutsideWindow(measurements) + 1; 
        
    
  


Though I think the stream version is much easier to read:
return (int) keys.stream()
        .map(db::get)
        .flatMap(measurements -> measurements == null ? Stream.empty() : measurements.stream())
        .filter(measurement -> measurement.timestamp >= startTime)
        .count();
timeline.author: freva

replies.bodyText:
You are right about the brackets, thanks!
Stream version: or even just
                return (int) keys.stream()
                                 .flatMap(key -> db.getOrDefault(key, List.of()).stream())
                                 .filter(measurement -> measurement.timestamp >= startTime)
                                 .count();

I guess this is way more expensive though, but you are right it's too early to worry about it.
